title: NASA Seeks Innovators for Lunar Waste Competition
summary: By Savannah Bullard  A new NASA competition, the LunaRecycle Challenge, is open and offering $3 million in prizes for innovations in recycling material waste on deep space missions.  As NASA continues efforts toward long-duration human space travel, including building a sustained human presence on the Moon through its Artemis missions, the agency needs novel solutions […]

title: NASA Astronaut Tracy C. Dyson to Discuss Science, Station Mission
summary: NASA astronaut Tracy C. Dyson will share details of her recent six-month mission aboard the International Space Station in a news conference at 11 a.m. EDT Friday, Oct. 4, at the agency’s Johnson Space Center in Houston. The news conference will air live on NASA+ and the agency’s website. Learn how to stream NASA content through a […]

title: Mariachi and Moonshots: Melissa Moreno Orchestrates Gateway Communications
summary: As a radio frequency wireless engineer in NASA’s Johnson Space Center Avionic Systems Division in Houston, Melissa Moreno makes an impact in space exploration while proudly sharing her cultural heritage in the NASA community.  Moreno works in the Electronic Systems Test Laboratory, developing communication systems critical to Gateway, NASA’s first lunar-orbiting space station. But her […]

title: Station Science Top News: Sept. 27, 2024
summary: Researchers found that long-duration spaceflight affected the mechanical properties of eye tissues, including reducing the stiffness of tissue around the eyeball. A better understanding of these changes could help researchers prevent, diagnose, and treat the vision impairment often seen in crew members. SANSORI, a Canadian Space Agency investigation, examined whether reduced stiffness of eye tissue contributes to […]

title: Aerospace Medicine Clerkship
summary: The application window for the April 2025 session is open. The next available session will convene Monday, March 31- Friday, April 25. title: We’re only beginning to understand the historic nature of Helene’s flooding
summary: How does a region that is nearly 500 miles from the Gulf become devastated by flooding?

title: Summary of the 10th SWOT Applications Workshop
summary: Introduction The tenth Surface Water Ocean Topography (SWOT) Applications Workshop took place December 7–8, 2023 at the California Institute of Technology Keck Institute for Space Studies.
